intro: Oldenlandia rugosa, commonly known as the rough oldenlandia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, showy yellow or white flowers. The plant typically grows as a herb or shrub, with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are often clustered in loose inflorescences, and it is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils. Oldenlandia rugosa is also noted for its use in traditional medicine in some regions.
